|blank_info = 46-23900 |blank1_name = GNIS feature ID |blank1_info = 1267402 |website = |footnotes = |pop_est_footnotes = }} Gayville is a town in the southeastern part of the U.S. state of South Dakota. It is located in Yankton County, and 382 people lived there at the 2020 census. Gayville became a town in 1892. ==References== Category:Towns in South Dakota Category:1892 establishments in the United States Category:1890s establishments in South Dakota
